lcn.p: First are those who are little more than the playsers of RPGs, that is, role-playing games. Of course, true RPG gamers are aware that it is their character in a game that is a Jedi, while they themselves are not. They are aware of this, whether their game is played with dice over a tabletop or in a live-action arena. However, the faux Jedi who are closely related to the RPG gamers lack this full cognizance. They take things literally from gaming manuals, and even fictional Star Wars media and run with the assumption that those things are real.

A true Jedi Realist might also express reality in terms that are borrowed from such fictional media, even the term "Jedi" being one such example. However, a true Jedi will put everything so borrowed through the filter and the crucible of real-life experience, which is one of the things that puts the "Realism" in "Jedi Realism". The faux Jedi of this variety do no such thing.
